      8f
      The Effect of pH on the Dimensionality of Coordination Polymers
      Pan, Long; Frydel, Thomas; Sander, Michelle B.; Huang, Xiaoying; Li, Jing
      Inorganic Chemistry (2001), 40 (6), 1271-1283CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reactions of simple alk. earth salts or their hydroxides with 3,5-pyrazoledicarboxylic acid (H3pdc) yielded seven new compds. At a lower pH level three 1-dimensional structures [Ca(Hpdc)(H2O)4]·2H2O (1), [Ca(Hpdc)(H2O)4]·H2O (2), and [Ba(H2pdc)2(H2O)4]·2H2O (6) were obtained by evapn. of the solns. resulting from hydro(solvo)thermal reactions of MCl2 (M = Ca, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O (1, 6) or in H2O/Et3N (2) at 150° for 3 days. Crystal structures of 1 and 2 contain zigzag chains of metal centers bridged by a single Hpdc2- ligand, whereas structure 6 consists of linear chains of metal centers bridged by two H2pdc- ligands. A dimer mol. [Sr(H3pdc)(H2pdc)2(H2O)3]2·2(H3pdc)·4H2O (4) was obtained from a similar hydrothermal reaction using Sr(ClO4)2·6H2O instead of MCl2. This compd. contains [2+2] metallomacrocycles. At higher pH levels (pH = 4-6), the three-dimensional polymers [M(Hpdc)(H2O)] (Ca 3, Sr 5, Ba 7 ) were isolated by reactions of MCl2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O/Et3N or in M(OH)2 (M = Ca, Sr, Ba) with H3pdc in H2O under hydro(solvo)thermal conditions (150°, 3 days). Ca and Sr are seven- and nine-coordinated in 3 and 5, resp.; Ba is nine- and ten-coordinated in 7. The increase in pH resulted in a higher connectivity level of ligands, which in turn leads to a higher dimensionality of the crystal structures. The correlation between the structures and pH values are discussed. Crystal data: for 1, monoclinic, space group P21/n, with a 8.382(2), b 12.621(3), c 11.767(2) Å, β 98.91(3)°, Z = 4; for 2, 3, and 5, monoclinic, space group P21/c, Z = 4, a 7.711(2), b 15.574(3), c 9.341(2) Å, β 96.73(3)°, Z = 4(2) (2), a 6.616(1), b 12.654(3), c 8.782(2) Å, β 103.65(3)°, Z = 4(3) (3), a 9.213(2), b 12.088(3), c 6.196(2) Å, β 98.96(3)° (5); for 4 and 7, triclinic, space group P‾1, with a 11.263(2), b 11.460(3), c 12.904(2) Å, α 71.54(3), β 98.96(3), γ 89.03(3)°, Z = 1(4) (4), a 7.107(1), b 9.780(2), c 11.431(2) Å, α 74.69(3), β 73.39(3), γ 85.29(3)°, Z = 2(7) (7); for 6, monoclinic, space group C2/c, with a 20.493(4), b 6.708(1), c 15.939(3) Å, β 123.56(3)°, Z = 4.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Hydroxylation of N-heterocycle ligands observed in two unusual mixed-valence CuI/CuII complexes
      Zhang, Xian-Ming; Tong, Ming-Liang; Chen, Xiao-Ming
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2002), 41 (6), 1029-1031CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      Structural evidence for the Gillard mechanism of covalent hydrates is provided by the prepn. and x-ray crystal structure characterization of two mixed-valence CuI/CuII complexes, [Cu4(obpy)4(tp)] (Hobpy = 6-hydroxy-2,2'-bipyridine, tp = terephthalate) and [Cu4(ophen)4(tp)] (Hophen = 2-hydroxy-1,10-phenanthroline), contg. 2,2'-bipyridine or 1,10-phenanthroline ligands in which a hydroxy group is added to a C atom adjacent to a N atom. Stabilization of the complexes from intermol. Cu...Cu interactions and π-π stacking interactions between arom. rings is discussed. These complexes were synthesized by hydrothermal treatment of Cu(NO3)2, the resp. N,N ligand, and terephthalic acid. Weak antiferromagnetic coupling of Cu2 units is obsd.

      9d
      Synthesis, Structure, and Magnetic Properties of Two New Vanadocarboxylates with Three-Dimensional Hybrid Frameworks
      Barthelet, K.; Riou, D.; Nogues, M.; Ferey, G.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2003), 42 (5), 1739-1743CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      (VIII(OH))2{C6H2(CO2)4}·4H2O (MIL-60) and VIII(OH){2(O2C)C6H2(COOH)2}·H2O (MIL-61) were hydrothermally synthesized from mixts. of VCl3, 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, and H2O heated for 3 days at 473 K. The structure of MIL-60 was solved from single-crystal x-ray diffraction data in the triclinic centrosym. space group P‾1 (no. 2) with a 6.3758(5), b 6.8840(5), c 9.0254(5) Å, α 69.010(2), β 85.197(2), γ 79.452(2)°, and Z = 1. The structure of MIL-61 was ab initio detd. from an x-ray powder diffraction pattern. MIL-61 crystallizes in the space group Pnma orthorhombic space group Pnma (no. 62) with a 14.8860(1), b 6.9164(1), c 10.6669(2) Å, and Z = 4. Both structures contain the same inorg. building block that consists of trans chains of VIIIO4(OH)2 octahedra. The three-dimensional frameworks of MIL-60 and MIL-61 are constituted by the linkage of these chains via the org. mols. so delimiting the channels or cages where the H2O mols. are encapsulated. The magnetic behavior of these two phases is presented: MIL-60 is paramagnetic, and MIL-61 antiferromagnetically orders below TN = 55(5) K.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXhtVakurg%253D&md5=12a5bbc8daaba094eba9aeb83d57ffa3
      (e) Ma, A. Q., Shi, Z., Xu, R. R., Pang, W. Q., and Zhu, L. G. Chem. Lett.2003 32 1010
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar

      Framework assembly engineering. Effects of nitro groups on assemblies of phenyldicarboxylates
      Ma, Ai-qing; Shi, Zhan; Xu, Ru-ren; Pang, Wen-qin; Zhu, Long-guan
      Chemistry Letters (2003), 32 (11), 1010-1011CODEN: CMLTAG; ISSN:0366-7022. (Chemical Society of Japan)
      A novel 2-dimensional complex, [Cu(nbdc)(phen)(H2O)] (nbdc = 2-nitro-1,4-benzenedicarboxylate dianion and phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), was synthesized and structurally characterized by single crystal x-ray anal. It exhibits nice fluorescent property. The modifying group plays a key role in the assembly of the framework.

      10a
      Rationally designed, polymeric, extended metal-ciprofloxacin complexes
      Xiao, Dong-Rong; Wang, En-Bo; An, Hai-Yan; Su, Zhong-Min; Li, Yang-Guang; Gao, Lei; Sun, Chun-Yan; Xu, Lin
      Chemistry - A European Journal (2005), 11 (22), 6673-6686CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Reactions of the antimicrobial fluoroquinolone ciprofloxacin (cfH) with metal salts in the presence of arom. polycarboxylate ligands or under basic conditions produce fourteen new metal-cfH complexes, namely, [Ba2(cf)2(1,4-bdc)(H2O)2].H2O (1), [Sr6(cf)6(1,4-bdc)3(H2O)6].2H2O (2), [M2(cfH)2(bptc)(H2O)2].8H2O (M = Mn (3) and Cd(4)), [M(cfH)(1,3-bdc)] (M = Mn (5), Co (6), and Zn (7)), [Zn2(cfH)4(1,4-bdc)](1,4-bdc).13H2O (8), [Ca(cfH)2(1,2-Hbdc)2].2H2O (9) and [M(cf)2].2.5H2O (M = Mn (10), Co (11), Zn (12), Cd (13), and Mg (14)) (1,4-bdc = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, bptc = 3,3',4,4'-benzophenonetetracarboxylate, 1,3-bdc = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,2-bdc = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate). Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses and further characterized by elemental analyses, IR spectra, and thermogravimetric analyses. The structures of 1 and 2 consist of unique two-dimensional arm-shaped layers. Compds. 3 and 4 are isostructural and feature 1-dimensional structures formed from the interconnection of [M2(cfH)2(H2O)2] dimers with bptc ligands. Compds. 5-7 are isostructural and contain double-chain-like ribbons constructed from [M2(cfH)2(CO2)2] dimers and 1,3-bdc. Compd. 8 consists of a pair of [Zn(cfH)2]2+ fragments bridged by a 1,4-bdc into a dinuclear dumbbell structure. Compd. 9 is a neutral monomeric complex. To the best of the authors' knowledge, compds. 1-9 are the first examples of metal-quinolone complexes that contain arom. polycarboxylate ligands. Compds. 10-14 are isostructural and exhibit interesting two-dimensional rhombic grids featuring large cavities with dimensions of 13.6 × 13.6 Å. Polymeric extended metal-cfH complexes have never been reported.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (b) Liang, Y. C., Hong, M. C., Su, W. P., Cao, R., and Zhang, W. J. Inorg. Chem.2001 40 4574
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10b
      Preparations, Structures, and Magnetic Properties of a Series of Novel Copper(II)-Lanthanide(III) Coordination Polymers via Hydrothermal Reaction
      Liang, Yucang; Hong, Maochun; Su, Weiping; Cao, Rong; Zhang, Wenjian
      Inorganic Chemistry (2001), 40 (18), 4574-4582CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The hydrothermal reaction of Ln2O3 (Ln = Er, Gd, and Sm), pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid (H2pydc), and Cu(II) reagents (CuO, Cu(OAc)2·2H2O, or CuCl2·2H2O) with a mole ratio of 1:2:4 gave six polymeric Cu(II)-Ln(III) complexes, [{Ln2Cu3(pydc)6(H2O)12}·4H2O]n (Ln = Er (1); Ln = Gd (2)), [{Ln4Cu2(pydc)8(H2O)12}·4H2O]n (Ln = Sm (3); Ln = Gd (4); Ln = Er (5)), and [{Gd2Cu2(pydc)4(H2O)8}·Cu(pydc)2·12H2O]n (6). 1 And 2 are isomorphous and crystallize in triclinic space group P‾1. Compds. 3-5 are isomorphous and crystallize in monoclinic space group P21/c. Compd. 6 crystallizes in triclinic space group P‾1. Complexes 1 and 2 have 1-dimensional zigzag chain structures and compds. 3-5 Display three-dimensional wavelike polymeric structures, while 6 has an infinite sandwich-type structure. The different structures of the complexes are induced by the different forms of Cu(II) reagents; the reactions of Cu(OAc)2·2H2O yield high Cu/Ln ratio products 1, 2 and 6, while the reactions of CuO or CuCl2·2H2O/2,2'-bipyridine results in low Cu/Ln ratio compds. 3-5. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibilities for 2, 4 and 5 were studied, and the thermal stabilities of complexes 2 and 4 were examd.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXlsFOqtbs%253D&md5=401cb23bc2aa20f21409efc0466ae955
      (c) Shi, X., Zhu, G. S., Wang, X. H., Li, G. H., Fang, Q. R., Wu, G., Ge, T., Xue, M., Zhao, X. J., Wang, R. W., and Qiu, S. L. Cryst. Growth Des.2005 5 207

      From a 1-D Chain, 2-D Layered Network to a 3-D Supramolecular Framework Constructed from a Metal-Organic Coordination Compound
      Shi, Xin; Zhu, Guangshan; Wang, Xiaohui; Li, Guanghua; Fang, Qianrong; Wu, Gang; Tian, Ge; Xue, Ming; Zhao, Xiaojun; Wang, Renwei; Qiu, Shilun
      Crystal Growth & Design (2005), 5 (1), 207-213CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Three new metal-org. coordination polymers, Cd(bpdc)(phen)2·2H2O (1) (H2bpdc = biphenyl-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid), Cd(BDC)(phen)·DMF (2) (H2BDC = benzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid), and Cd2(btec)(phen)2(H2O)2 (3) (H4btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid), were synthesized under different conditions by using the metal-org. coordination compd. Cd(phen)2(NO3)2 as the metal source instead of inorg. metal salt. Polymer 1 is a 1-dimensional zigzag chain, which crystallizes in the monoclinic system, Cc space group. Polymer 2 is a 2-dimensional layered network, which crystallizes in the monoclinic system, P2/c space group. The 3-dimensional supramol. framework 3 crystallizes in the triclinic system, P‾1 space group. The particular interest of 3 is two entirely independent Cd atoms in its structure. They sep. form 1-dimensional polymeric chains, which are alternately arranged to form a 3-dimensional supramol. framework through interchain H bonds. Addnl., these three compds. show strong fluorescence in the solid state at room temp.

      10d
      Copper(II), Cobalt(II), and Nickel(II) Complexes with a Bulky Anthracene-Based Carboxylic Ligand: Syntheses, Crystal Structures, and Magnetic Properties
      Liu, Chun-Sen; Wang, Jun-Jie; Yan, Li-Fen; Chang, Ze; Bu, Xian-He; Sanudo, E. Carolina; Ribas, Joan
      Inorganic Chemistry (2007), 46 (16), 6299-6310CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      To systematically explore the influence of the bulky arom. ring skeleton with a large conjugated π-system on the structures and properties of their complexes, six CuII, CoII, and NiII complexes with the anthracene-based carboxylic ligand anthracene-9-carboxylic acid (HL1), were synthesized and characterized, sometimes incorporating different auxiliary ligands: [Cu2(L1)4(MeOH)2](MeOH) (1), [Cu4(L1)6(L2)4](NO3)2(H2O)2 (2), {[Cu2(L1)4(L3)](MeOH)0.25}∞ (3), [Co2(L1)4(L4)2(μ-H2O)](MeOH) (4), {[Co(L1)2(L5)(MeOH)2]}∞ (5), and {[Ni(L1)2(L5)(MeOH)2]}∞ (6) (L2 = 2,2'-bipyridine, L3 = 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane, L4 = 1,10-phenanthroline, and L5 = 4,4'-bipyridine). 1 Has a dinuclear structure that is further assembled to form a 1-dimensional (1D) chain and then a two-dimensional (2D) network by the C-H···O H-bonding and π···π stacking interactions jointly. 2 Has a tetranuclear structure due to the existence of the chelating L2 ligand. 3 Possesses a 1-dimensional chain structure by incorporating the related auxiliary ligand L3, which is further interlinked via interchain π···π stacking, resulting in a three-dimensional (3D) network. 4 Also has a dinuclear structure and then forms a higher-dimensional supramol. network through intermol. π···π stacking and/or C-H···π interactions. 5 And 6 are isostructural complexes, except they involve different metal ions, showing 1-dimensional chain structures, which are also assembled into 2-dimensional networks from the different crystallog. directions by interchain π···π stacking and C-H···π interactions, resp. The steric bulk of the anthracene ring in HL1 plays an important role in the formation of 1-6. The magnetic properties of the complexes were studied, and the very long intermetallic distances result in weak magnetic coupling, with the exception of 1 and 3, which adopt the typical paddle-wheel structure of Cu acetate and are thus strongly coupled.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (e) Gu, X. J., and Xue, D. F. CrystEngComm.2007 9 471
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10e
      Self-assembly of 3-D 4d-4f coordination frameworks based on 1-D inorganic heterometallic chains and linear organic linkers
      Gu, Xiaojun; Xue, Dongfeng
      CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (6), 471-477CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Four novel 4d-4f heterometallic coordination polymers, namely, LnAg(pydc)2(Hnic)0.5 [Ln = Nd (1), Eu (2); H2pydc = pyridine-3,4-dicarboxylic acid, Hnic = nicotinic acid], and LnAg(inic)2(nicO)·0.5H2O [Ln = Nd (3), Eu (4); Hinic = isonicotinic acid, H2nicO = 2-hydroxynicotinic acid], were synthesized and characterized. Compds. 1 and 2 exhibit three-dimensional (3-D) coordination frameworks constructed by 1-dimensional (1-D) inorg. heterometallic chains and linear pydc linkers. The 1-dimensional channels occupied by disordered Hnic mols. emerge. To the authors' knowledge, both compds. represent the first examples of 3-dimensional open-framework 4d-4f heterometallic coordination frameworks. Compds. 3 and 4 display 3-dimensional covalent frameworks composed of 1-dimensional inorg. heterometallic chains joined by inic ligands, representing the first examples of 3-dimensional 4d-4f coordination frameworks constructed by inorg. heterometallic chain and mixed linear and nonlinear ligands with same donors. The luminescent properties of 2 and 4 were also studied.

      Zn(tbip) (H2tbip = 5-tert-Butyl Isophthalic Acid): A Highly Stable Guest-Free Microporous Metal Organic Framework with Unique Gas Separation Capability
      Pan, Long; Parker, Brett; Huang, Xiaoying; Olson, David H.; Lee, JeongYong; Li, Jing
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2006), 128 (13), 4180-4181CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      A novel guest-free microporous metal org. framework (GFMMOF), Zn(tbip) (H2tbip = 5-tert-Bu isophthalic acid) was synthesized and structurally characterized. It contains 1-dimensional close-packed open channels with a pore diam. of 4.5 Å. It demonstrates a remarkable thermal stability, a unique ability to sep. MeOH from di-Me ether or H2O, and is among the microporous MOFs having the highest adsorbed H d. (0.054 g/cm3 at 77 K and 1 atm).

      12a
      Systematic design of pore size and functionality in isoreticular MOFs and their application in methane storage
      Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Kim, Jaheon; Rosi, Nathaniel; Vodak, David; Wachter, Joseph; O'Keeffe, Michael; Yaghi, Omar M.
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (2002), 295 (5554), 469-472CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
      A strategy based on reticulating metal ions and org. carboxylate links into extended networks has been advanced to a point that allowed the design of porous structures in which pore size and functionality could be varied systematically. Metal-org. framework (MOF-5), a prototype of a new class of porous materials and one that is constructed from octahedral Zn-O-C clusters and benzene links, was used to demonstrate that its three-dimensional porous system can be functionalized with the org. groups -Br, -NH2, -OC3H7, -OC5H11, -C2H4, and -C4H4 and that its pore size can be expanded with the long mol. struts biphenyl, tetrahydropyrene, pyrene, and terphenyl. We synthesized an isoreticular series (one that has the same framework topol.) of 16 highly cryst. materials whose open space represented up to 91.1% of the crystal vol., as well as homogeneous periodic pores that can be incrementally varied from 3.8 to 28.8 Å. One member of this series exhibited a high capacity for methane storage (240 cm3 at std. temp.), and others the lowest densities (0.41 to 0.21 g/cm3) for a cryst. material at room temp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      A coordination polymer based on twofold interpenetrating three-dimensional four-connected nets of 42638 topology, [CuSCN(bpa)] [bpa = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane]
      Wang, Quan-Ming; Guo, Guo-Cong; Mak, Thomas C. W.
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge) (1999), (18), 1849-1850CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The novel coordination polymer [CuSCN(bpa)] [bpa = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane] was prepd. and shown from an x-ray crystal structure to consist of two interpenetrating three-dimensional four-connected frameworks of rare 42638 topol., each being constructed from the cross-linkage of infinite zigzag [(CuSCN)2]∞ chains by bpa ligands. All four independent bpa ligands in the complex occupy 1‾ sites and exhibit anti conformation.

      12d
      Self-Assembly of a Mixed-Ligand Metal-Coordination Polymeric Network of Cadmium(II) Croconate with 4,4'-Bipyridine
      Wang, Chih-Chieh; Yang, Cheng-Han; Tseng, Shih-Min; Lee, Gene-Hsiang; Chiang, Yung-Ping; Sheu, Hwo-Shuenn
      Inorganic Chemistry (2003), 42 (25), 8294-8299CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A new Cd croconate (C5O52-) complex, [Cd2(C5O5)2(4,4'-bpy)(H2O)]∞ (I; 4,4-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) with an extended network was synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction studies. I crystallizes in the monoclinic system, space group P21/n, with empirical formula C20H12Cd2N2O12, a 15.9623(3), b 7.5837(1), c 18.1181(3) Å, β 99.95(2)°, and Z = 4. Structural detn. reveals that I has a bilayered network, contg. two crystallog. independent Cd(II) ions in different coordination environments. Cd(1) lies in a distorted pentagonal bipyramidal environment, consisting of three croconate ions and one 4,4'-bpy N donor, while Cd(2) lies in a distorted octahedral environment, consisting of two croconate anions, one 4,4'-bpy N donor, and one H2O mol. Of the two crystallog. independent croconate ligands, one presents a bis-bidentate adjacent μ3-coordination mode and the other a new bidentate/three-adjacent μ5-coordination mode. A two-dimensional hybrid layer is formed by two rectangular boxes as the building units through the connectivity between Cd(II) and croconate and 4,4'-bpy ligands.

      New Journal of Chemistry (2004), 28 (2), 180-182CODEN: NJCHE5; ISSN:1144-0546. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The novel coordination polymers [M(μ3-C5O5)0.5(μ4-C5O5)0.5(anti-dpe)0.5(gauche-dpe)0.5] [M = Mn, 1a; Fe, 1b; Cd, 1c; C5O5 = croconate, dpe = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane] were prepd. and characterized by x-ray crystallog. The structure consists of a two-dimensional bilayered framework, each being constructed from the cross-linkage of two infinite 2-dimensional [M(μ3-C5O5)0.5(μ4-C5O5)0.5(anti-dpe)0.5] brick-wall layers by gauche-dpe ligands.

      12f
      Structural diversity and properties of M(II) 4-carboxyl phenoxyacetate complexes with 0D-, 1D-, 2D- and 3D M-cpoa framework
      Zhuang, Wenjuan; Zheng, Xiangjun; Li, Licun; Liao, Daizheng; Ma, Hui; Jin, Linpei
      CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (8), 653-667CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Nine new cobalt(II), nickel(II) and zinc complexes with an unsym. 4-carboxymethoxybenzoate (HO2CC6H4-4-OCH2CO2H, H2cpoa) ligand, bridged by 4,4'-bipyridine (4,4'-bpy) and 4,4'-1,2-ethanediylbipyridine (bpe) ligands, [Co(Hcpoa)2(bpe)2(H2O)2] (1), [Co(cpoa)(bpe)1.5(H2O)]·H2O (2), [Co(Hcpoa)2(4,4'-bpy)2] (3), [Co(4,4'-bpy)(H2O)4]·[Co(cpoa)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (4), [Ni(cpoa)(4,4'-bpy)(H2O)2] (5), [Ni(cpoa)(bpe)1.5(H2O)]·H2O (6), [Zn2(cpoa)2(bpe)(H2O)] (7), [Zn(cpoa)(bpe)0.5]·0.5(i-C3H7OH) (8) and [Zn(cpoa)(bpe)0.5]·0.5(n-C3H7OH) (9) were prepd. under hydro/solvothermal conditions. X-ray single-crystal structural analyses reveal that they have metal-org. frameworks ranging from 0D (1), 1D (3, 4), 2D (5, 7, 8) to 3D structures (2, 6, 9). The reaction of the CoCl2/H2cpoa/bpe (1:1:1) system results in the formation of complex 1 at the starting pH of ca. 8, and complex 2 at pH 12. The reaction of CoCl2/H2cpoa/4,4'-bpy (1:1:1) forms complex 3 with a 1D chain structure, while a molar ratio of 1:1:0.5 leads to the formation of complex 4 with two 1D metal-org. frameworks of rarely reported homometal complex ion pairs. By changing the added org. solvent, the 2D layer framework of complex 8 and the microporous 3D framework of complex 9 were obtained under the same reaction conditions. The guest n-C3H7OH mols. occupy 1D channels in 9. Thermogravimetric and powder x-ray diffraction analyses show that the microporous 3D framework of 9 is maintained after the removal of the guest mol. Reversible desolvation/resolvation process can be obsd. for the complex 9. The magnetic measurements show antiferromagnetic interactions between the metal ions in 2, 4 and 5, and antiferromagnetic interaction in the range of 300-18 K and ferromagnetic interaction between Ni(II) ions below 18 K in 6.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (a) Noro, S., Kitaura, R., Kondo, M., Kitagawa, S., Ishii, T., Matsuzaka, H., and Yamashita, M. J. Am. Chem. Soc.2002 124 2568
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      13a
      Framework Engineering by Anions and Porous Functionalities of Cu(II)/4,4'-bpy Coordination Polymers
      Noro, Shin-ichiro; Kitaura, Ryo; Kondo, Mitsuru; Kitagawa, Susumu; Ishii, Tomohiko; Matsuzaka, Hiroyuki; Yamashita, Masahiro
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2002), 124 (11), 2568-2583CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      A combination of framework-builder Cu2+ and 4,4'-bipyridine (4,4'-bpy) ligand) and framework-regulator (AF6 type anions; A = Si, Ge, and P) provides novel porous coordination polymers. The highly porous coordination polymers {[Cu(AF6)(4,4'-bpy)2]·8H2O}n (A = Si (1a·8H2O), Ge (2a·8H2O)) afford robust 3-dimensional (3-D), microporous networks (3-dimensional Regular Grid) by using AF62- anions. The channel size of these complexes is ∼8 × 8 Å2 along the c-axis and 6 × 2 Å2 along the a- or b-axes. When compds. 1a·8H2O or 2a·8H2O were immersed in H2O, a conversion of 3-dimensional networks (1a·8H2O or 2a·8H2O) to interpenetrated networks {[Cu(4,4'-bpy)2(H2O)2]·AF6}n (A = Si (1b) and Ge (2b)) (2-dimensional Interpenetration) took place. This 2-dimensional interpenetrated network 1b shows unique dynamic anion-exchange properties, which accompany drastic structural conversions. When a PF6- monoanion instead of AF62- dianions was used as the framework-regulator with another co-counteranion (coexistent anions), porous coordination polymers with various types of frameworks, {[Cu2(4,4'-bpy)5(H2O)4]·anions·2H2O·4EtOH}n (anions = 4PF6- (3·2H2O·4EtOH), 2PF6- + 2ClO4- (4·2H2O·4EtOH)) (2-dimensional Double-Layer), {[Cu2(PF6)(NO3)(4,4'-bpy)4]·2PF6·2H2O}n (5·2PF6·2H2O) (3-dimensional Undulated Grid), {[Cu(PF6)(4,4'-bpy)2(MeCN)]·PF6·2MeCN}n (6·2MeCN) (2-dimensional Grid), and {[Cu(4,4'-bpy)2(H2O)2]·PF6·BF4}n (7) (2-dimensional Grid), were obtained, where the three modes of PF6- anions are obsd. 5·2PF6·2H2O has rare PF6- bridges. The PF6- and NO3- monoanions alternately link to the Cu(II) centers in the undulated 2-dimensional sheets of [Cu(4,4'-bpy)2]n to form a 3-dimensional porous network. The free PF6- anions are included in the channels. 6·2MeCN affords both free and terminal-bridged PF6- anions. 3·2H2O·4EtOH, 4·2H2O·4EtOH, and 7 bear free PF6- anions. All of the anions in 3·2H2O·4EtOH and 4·2H2O·4EtOH are freely located in the channels constructed from a host network. Interestingly, these Cu(II) frameworks are rationally controlled by counteranions and selectively converted to other frameworks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XhtlSis7o%253D&md5=68e5368ad20aba25a7a925757ec89039
      (b) Hennigar, T. L., MacQuarrie, D. C., Losier, P., Rogers, R. D., and Zaworotko, M. J. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. Engl.1997 36 972
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar

      Supramolecular isomerism in coordination polymers: conformational freedom of ligands in [Co(NO3)2(1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane)1.5]n
      Hennigar, Tracy L.; MacQuarrie, Donald C.; Losier, Pierre; Rogers, Robin D.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition in English (1997), 36 (9), 972-973CODEN: ACIEAY; ISSN:0570-0833. (VCH)
      The dramatic effect on network morphol. that conformational freedom is a ligand can impart to a coordination polymer is reported. 1,2-Bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (L), able to adopt gauche or anti conformations, and [Co(NO3)2L1.5]n (I) can exist in at least 3 different supramol. isomers. Thus I was prepd. and characterized by crystal structural anal., identifying 3 entirely different network structures. In one conformer 2 L are gauche and 1 anti whereas in the 2nd conformer 2 are anti and 1 gauche and in the 3rd all are anti.

      13c
      An unprecedented triply interpenetrated chiral network of 'square-planar' metal centers from the self-assembly of copper(II) nitrate and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethyne
      Carlucci, Lucia; Ciani, Gianfranco; Macchi, Piero; Proserpio, Davide M.
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge) (1998), (17), 1837-1838CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Copper(II) nitrate reacts with 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethyne (L) in ethanol to yield mixts. contg., besides the 1-dimensional ladder-like polymer [CuL(NO3)2]·0.5EtOH (1), a networked species {[CuL2(H2O)2][CuL2(NO3)(H2O)]2}(NO3)4·(L)·1.33H2O (2). 1 And 2 were characterized by x-ray crystallog. (1: monoclinic, space group C2/c, R = 0.093; 2: trigonal, space group P3121, R = 0.0789). 2 Has a triply interpenetrated chiral framework structure based on pseudo-square planar metal centers, showing a topol. theor. predicted but never obsd. before, contg. uncoordinated ligands as guest mols.

      Two mixed-valence copper(I,II) imidazolate coordination polymers: metal-valence tuning approach for new topological structures
      Huang, Xiao-Chun; Zhang, Jie-Peng; Lin, Yan-Yong; Yu, Xiao-Lan; Chen, Xiao-Ming
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2004), (9), 1100-1101CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A new metal-valence tuning synthetic approach was used to generate two new mixed-valence Cu(I,II) coordination polymers Cu2(Im)3 and Cu3(Im)4 (Him = imidazole), which are an unprecedented uninodal 4-connected 4.85 topol. net and a 4-connected (4,4) net, resp., as detd. by x-ray crystallog. The compds. were prepd. by hydrothermal reaction of a copper(II) salt with HIm and added aq. NH3 acting possibly as both base and reducing agent. Short intermetallic Cu(I)...Cu(I) contacts, close to the van der Waals radius sum of the copper atoms (2.8 Å), extend through Cu2(Im)3 along the a-axis into infinite Cu(I) chains. Unusually short C-H...π hydrogen bonds (2.24 and 2.50 Å) are present in Cu3(Im)4.

      Blue photoluminescent zinc coordination polymers with supertetranuclear cores
      Tao, Jun; Tong, Ming-Liang; Shi, Jian-Xin; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Ng, Seik Weng
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge) (2000), (20), 2043-2044CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two- and three-dimensional coordination polymers consisting of Zn4O [or Zn4(OH)2] cores, dicarboxylate (isophthalate (i.p.) or fumarate (fa)) and 4,4'-bipyridine ligands as building blocks, [Zn4O(i.p.)3(4,4'-bipy)] (1) and [Zn4(OH)2(fa)3(4,4'-bipy)2] (2), were hydrothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by x-ray single-crystal anal. 1 And 2 exhibit intense photoluminescence in the solid state, and may be good candidates for blue-light emitting diode devices.

      14b
      New Materials in Hydrothermal Synthesis
      Feng, Shouhua; Xu, Ruren
      Accounts of Chemical Research (2001), 34 (3), 239-247CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
      A review, with 61 refs., describes the hydrothermal synthesis of some new materials including microporous crystals, ionic conductors, complex oxides and fluorides, low-dimensional aluminophosphates, inorg.-org. hybrid materials, and particularly condensed materials such as diamond and inorg. helical chains. Hydrothermal synthesis in biol. and environment sciences is also introduced. The increasing interest in hydrothermal synthesis derives from its advantages in terms of high reactivity of reactants, easy control of soln. or interface reactions, formation of metastable and unique condensed phases, less air pollution, and low energy consumption.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3cXovV2ktr0%253D&md5=4ac98cc7204d3dfc44cb1015d1be8848
      (c) Lu, J. Y. Coord. Chem. Rev.2003 246 327
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      14c
      Crystal engineering of Cu-containing metal-organic coordination polymers under hydrothermal conditions
      Lu, Jack Y.
      Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2003), 246 (1-2), 327-347CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier Science B.V.)
      A review is presented on Cu-contg. polymeric coordination compds. synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. The rapid growth of hydrothermal synthesis of new coordination polymers is largely accredited to the developments in crystal engineering via functional network design. Both projected and unexpected framework structures were obtained through oxidn., redn., substitution, chem. rearrangement and regular hydrothermal reactions. New methods and reaction pathways play crucial roles in the formation of novel structures and topol. under hydrothermal conditions. This review covers copper iodine-contg. metal-org. coordination polymers, copper pyridylcarboxylate-contg. metal-org. coordination polymers, and metastable coordination polymers with active copper open metal (OM) sites.

      Two novel inorganic-organic hybrid frameworks based on InIII-BTC and InIII-BTEC
      Lin, Zheng-Zhong; Jiang, Fei-Long; Chen, Lian; Yuan, Da-Qiang; Zhou, You-Fu; Hong, Mao-Chun
      European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2005), (1), 77-81CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Hydrothermal reactions of InCl3 with 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC) or pyromellitic dianhydride produced [In2(BTC)2(H2O)2]n·2nH2O (1) and [In2(H2BTEC)2(OH)2]n·2nH2O (2), resp. (H4BTEC = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid), which were characterized by x-ray crystallog. The structure of 1 is a 2-dimensional double-layer network, while that of 2 is a 3-dimensional framework constructed from chains of corner-linked octahedra. Intense greenish-blue emissions at 494 nm (λex = 325 nm) for 1 and 489 nm (λex = 337 nm) for 2 were obsd. in the solid state.

      Diversity of Coordination Architecture of Metal 4,5-Dicarboxyimidazole
      Fang, Rui-Qin; Zhang, Xian-Ming
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (12), 4801-4810CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Seven complexes of metal imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3dcbi), namely, [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)3]·H2O (1·α), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·β), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·γ), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2] (2), [Cd(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (3), [Cd5(Hdcbi)2(dcbi)2(H2O)]·xH2O (4), [Cd2(Hdcbi)(C2O4)] (5), [Ag5(Hdcbi)2(CN)] (6), and [Mn(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (7), were hydro(solvo)thermally synthesized by fine control over synthetic conditions such as stoichiometry, solvent, and pH value. X-ray single-crystal structural analyses reveal that they have rich structural chem. ranging from mononuclear (1), 1-dimensional (2), and two-dimensional (3 and 7) to three-dimensional (4-6), among which 1 crystallizes in three types (α, β, and γ) of polymorphs. Seven coordination modes of Hndcbi ranging from monodentate to μ5 were obsd., among which four modes are found 1st. The coordination geometries of the Cd(II) sites vary from five-coordinate trigonal bipyramid and square pyramid, six-coordinate octahedron to seven-coordinate pentagonal bipyramid. Analyses of the synthetic conditions and structures of the Cd(II) complexes show that the influences of the solvent and the metal-to-ligand molar ratio are very important to the products and coordination modes of Hndcbi (n = 0, 1, 2). Studies of the coordination modes of Hndcbi and the structures of the Cd(II) complexes also reveal that the singly deprotonated H2dcbi generally coordinates in the monodentate imidazole-N or N,O-chelate mode to result in mononuclear structures, the doubly deprotonated Hdcbi coordinates in the μ2, μ3, or μ4 mode to generate 1-dimensional or two-dimensional structures, and the triply deprotonated dcbi can coordinate in the μ5 mode to form three-dimensional structures. The cyanide was in situ formed via C-C bond cleavage of acetonitrile during the prepn. of 6, which adopts a rare μ4-kC,kC:kN,kN mode to bridge four Ag(I) ions. The microporous three-dimensional framework of 4 is maintained after the removal of the guest mols. Compds. 1-5 show strong violet emissions with maxima around 380 nm, tentatively attributed to the ligand-centered transition.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Construction of a Three-fold Parallel Interpenetration Network and Bilayer Structure Based on Copper(II) and Trimesic Acid
      Chen, Wen-Xian; Wu, Shu-Ting; Long, La-Sheng; Huang, Rong-Bin; Zheng, Lan-Sun
      Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (6), 1171-1175CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Solvothermal reactions of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O with trimesic acid (H3BTC) at different pH conditions yield two coordination polymers of [Cu3(BTC)2(H2O)3(NH3)4]n·2nH2O (1) and [Cu4(BTC)2(OH)2(H2O)2(NH3)4]n (2). Crystal structural anal. reveals that complex 1 exhibits a three-fold parallel interpenetration network and complex 2 shows a two-dimensional bilayer structure. Crystal data are orthorhombic, space group Pbcn, a = 11.242(3) Å, b = 16.963(4) Å, c = 13.898(4) Å, Z = 4 for 1 and monoclinic, space group C2/c, a = 18.887(4) Å, b = 10.761(2) Å, c = 14.488(3) Å, β = 126.100(3)°, Z = 4 for 2.

      Silver(I) complexes with oxazoline-containing tripodal ligands: structure variation via counter anions and reaction conditions
      Huang, Yong-Qing; Shen, Zhong-Liang; Okamura, Taka-aki; Wang, Yan; Wang, Xiao-Feng; Sun, Wei-Yin; Yu, Jin-Quan; Ueyama, Norikazu
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (2), 204-213CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Seven new Ag(I) complexes [Ag2(L)2(CF3SO3)2] (1), [Ag2(L)2(CH3SO3)2] (2) [Ag2(L)2](BF4)2 (3), [Ag3(L)2(NO3)2]NO3·5H2O (4), [Ag2(L)(NO3)2]·MeOH (5), [Ag2(L)2](ClO4)2 (6) and [Ag3(L)2(MeCN)3](ClO4)3 (7) were synthesized by reactions of 1,3,5-tris(2-oxazolinyl)benzene (L) with varied Ag(I) salts under different conditions. The influences of counteranions and reaction conditions on the structure of the complexes are discussed. Three complexes 1, 2 and 3 with two kinds of different 1-dimensional chain structures were obtained under the same synthetic conditions by using different Ag(I) salts, and the ligand L was found to adopt bis-monodentate and tris-monodentate coordination modes resp. However, by using the same AgNO3 or AgClO4 but different reaction solvents, 4 and 5 or 6 and 7, resp., were isolated resp. Complexes 4 and 5 have different 1-dimensional chain structures, and 6 is isostructural with 3. However, 7 is a trinuclear, propeller-shaped M3L2 supramol. capsule in which L adopts a cis,cis,cis-conformation, while the ligand L in 3-6 has cis,trans,trans-conformation. The nature of the counteranions, such as their size, coordination ability and coordination mode, and the reaction conditions all have great impact on the structure of the complexes. The complexes were also characterized by electrospray mass spectrometry. Also, complex 7 exhibited modest 2nd-harmonic-generation (SHG) efficiency.

      15e
      Controllable Assembly of Metal-Directed Coordination Polymers under Diverse Conditions: A Case Study of the MII-H3tma/Bpt Mixed-Ligand System
      Du, Miao; Jiang, Xiu-Juan; Zhao, Xiao-Jun
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (10), 3998-4006CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      New metal-org. polymeric complexes, {[Co(bpt)(Htma)(H2O)3]·2.25H2O}n (1), [Co(bpt)(Htma)(H2O)]n (2), [Ni(bpt)(Htma)(H2O)]n (3), [Zn(bpt)2(H2tma)2]·6H2O (4), {[Cd(bpt)(Htma)(H2O)]·(EtOH)(H2O)1.5}n (5), and {[Cd(bpt)(Htma)(H2O)2]·5.5H2O}n (6), were prepd. from soln. reactions of 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole (bpt) and trimesic acid (H3tma) with different metal salts under diverse conditions. All these compds. were structurally detd. by x-ray single-crystal diffraction, and the bulk new materials were further identified by x-ray powder diffraction. Complexes 1 and 6 show 1-dimensional zigzag or linear Htma-bridged polymeric chains, with the terminal bpt ligands as pendants, which are extended to 2-dimensional H-bonded arrays with 4.82 or (6,3) network topol. Coordination polymers 2 and 3, in which the 2-dimensional corrugated metal-org. frameworks make the interdigitated 3-dimensional packing, are isostructural. Complex 4 has a mononuclear structure, and its subunits are H-bonded to each other to give a 2-dimensional gridlike net. For complex 5, the CdII centers are linked by bpt/Htma ligands to form a 2-dimensional (4,4) coordination layer, and these layers are interdigitated in pairs. Notably, secondary noncovalent forces, such as H bonds, play an important role in extending and stabilizing these structural topologies. Distinct products were obtained for CoII (1 and 2) and CdII (5 and 6) under ambient or hydrothermal conditions; however, for NiII and ZnII, single products, 3 and 4, are generated. The thermal stabilities of 1-6 were studied by TGA of mass loss. The desorption/adsorption properties of the porous material 5 are also discussed. Solid-state luminescent spectra of the ZnII and CdII complexes, 4-6, indicate intense fluorescent emissions at ca. 380 nm.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      16a
      Flexible Disulfoxides as Bridging Ligands for Copper(II) Coordination Architectures: Fine Tuning the Complex Structures by Ligand Modifications
      Li, Jian-Rong; Bu, Xian-He; Zhang, Ruo-Hua; Ribas, Joan
      Crystal Growth & Design (2005), 5 (5), 1919-1932CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Ten disulfoxide-CuII coordination architectures, {[Cu(meso-Lb1)2(ClO4)](ClO4)}n (1B), [Cu(meso-Lb2)2(ClO4)2]n (2B), [Cu(rac-Lb3)2(ClO4)2]n (3B), {[Cu(meso-Lb3)3](ClO4)2}n (3B'), [Cu(meso-Lc1)2(ClO4)2]n (1C), [Cu(meso-Lc2)2(ClO4)]2(ClO4)2(CHCl3)2 (2C), {[Cu(meso-Lc3)2(ClO4)](ClO4)}n (3C), [Cu(meso-Ld1)2(ClO4)2]n (1D), {[Cu2(rac-Ld2)4(ClO4)2](ClO4)2(CHCl3)}n (2D), and [Cu(rac-Ld3)2(ClO4)2]n (3D), were obtained by the reaction of Cu(ClO4)2 with nine structurally related flexible disulfoxide ligands, RS(O)(CH2)nS(O)R (n = 2-4; R = -CH2CH3, -CH2CH2CH3, -CH2CH2CH2CH3 for Lbn-1, Lcn-1, and Ldn-1, resp.) in the presence of dehydrating reagent (diethoxyethane) in acetone/CHCl3. The x-ray crystal structural analyses of the complexes revealed that all of them display a 2-dimensional network structure, except for 2B and 2C, which display a 1-dimensional and a dinuclear cage structure, resp. All 2-dimensional systems have a (4,4) topol. arrangement with different conformations, except for 3B', which has a (3,6) structure. It is noteworthy that complexes 3B and 3B', with different structures, were obtained in the same reaction system, being a relatively rare case. In all of the complexes the ligands react in the bis-monodentate coordination mode, acting as linkage bridges: this feature is important for the assembly of the polymeric complexes. The configuration inversion of some disulfoxide ligands was obsd. when reacting with CuII ions. In combination with other reported disulfoxide-CuII complexes, a systematic structural comparison was performed so as to summarize some general relations among the spacer lengths, terminal groups of related ligands, and structures of the complexes. The magnetic behavior of three complexes, 1B-3B, as examples, was studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXmtlSktLk%253D&md5=175b73dc65d57bfa6627b937e918e097
      (b) Zhang, X. J., Zhou, X. P., and Li, D. Cryst. Growth Des.2006 6 1440
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      16b
      Anion-Directed Assembly of Macrocycle and Helix
      Zhang, Xuanjun; Zhou, Xiao-Ping; Li, Dan
      Crystal Growth & Design (2006), 6 (6), 1440-1444CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Self-assembly of the flexible ligand N,N'-bis(3-pyridylmethyl)thiourea (bpt) with ZnCl2 and CdCl2 in the absence and presence of KSCN yielded a short series of novel complexes [Zn(bpt)Cl2]2 (1), [Zn(bpt)(SCN)2]n (2), [Cd(bpt)2Cl2·2CH3OH]n (3) and [Cd(bpt)2(SCN)2]n (4) with macrocyclic, helical, double-helical, and 1D polymeric structures as revealed by X-ray crystallog. Different metal ions, hydrogen bonds and counteranions play significant roles in the final crystal structures. The NCS- anion was found to favor the formation of helical structures whereas the Cl- anion favored macrocycle formation. Photoluminescence (PL) measurements revealed that complex 2 (Zn(bpt)(SCN)2) with a helical structure exhibits enhanced emissions compared to those of the ligand and other complexes. The anion-directed assembly as well as the interesting emissions may provide useful information for further design of metal-org. compds. with novel structures and properties.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XktVSkt7c%253D&md5=0e87530a029f07787bc7750c928e5ab9
      (c) Wang, R. H., Yuan, D. Q., Jiang, F. L., Han, L., Gong, Y. Q., and Hong, M. C. Cryst. Growth Des.2006 6 1351
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      16c
      Anion Effect on the Structural Conformation of Tetranuclear Cadmium(II) Complexes
      Wang, Ruihu; Yuan, Daqiang; Jiang, Feilong; Han, Lei; Gong, Yaqiong; Hong, Maochun
      Crystal Growth & Design (2006), 6 (6), 1351-1360CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six tetranuclear Cd(II) complexes, Na[Cd4(hmt)2(H2O)6(dpa)4(NO3)]·8H2O (1), Na[Cd4(hmt)2(MeOH)2(H2O)4(dpa)4I]·8H2O (2), Na[Cd4(hmt)2(H2O)6(dpa)4Br]·8H2O (3), Na2[Cd4(hmt)2(H2O)6(dpa)4(SCN)2]·4H2O (4), {Na[Cd4(hmt)2(H2O)6(dpa)4Cl](H2O)4}n (5), and {[Cd4(hmt)3(H2O)5(dpa)4](H2O)10}n (6) (hmt = hexamethylenetetramine, H2dpa = diphenic acid), were synthesized by reactions of H2dpa, hmt, and CdX2 (X = NO3-, I-, Br-, Cl-, SCN-, and OAc-). All the complexes contain a basic unit [Cd4(dpa)4], in which four dpa ligands in a chelating bis-bidentate coordination mode link two six-coordinate and two seven-coordinate Cd(II) centers. The research result demonstrates that the nature of the counterions has an important effect on the assembly process of neutral and anionic mixed ligands with metal ions. In 1-3, NO3-, I-, or Br- bridges the two seven-coordinate CdII centers of the unit to form a discrete tetranuclear mol. with a cis-conformation and hmt as a terminal ligand coordinated to each of the two six-coordinate Cd(II) centers. Two SCN- in 4 acting as terminal ligands generate a discrete trans-conformational tetranuclear cluster anion. The hmt in 5 acting as a μ-ligand links cis-conformational tetranuclear units by Cd-N bonds to generate a 1-dimensional chain structure, while the hmt in 6 acting as a μ-ligand links the tetranuclear units by Cd-N bonds to generate a two-dimensional layer structure composed of a planar-conformation [Cd4(dpa)4] unit. The fluorescent studies in the solid at room temp. show that the six complexes exhibit strong violet or blue emissions in the range 370-500 nm arising from the charge-transfer transition and that the bridging anions have a significant effect on their fluorescent properties.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XjsleltL0%253D&md5=cab8823bdb2fef8675711edc8a0a2c92
      (d) Ghosh, S. K., Savitha, G., and Bharadwaj, P. K. Inorg. Chem.2004 43 5497

      16e
      Influence of the Reaction Conditions on the Self-assembly of Lead(II) 5-Sulfosalicylate Coordination Polymers with Chelating Amine Ligands
      Fan, Sai-Rong; Zhu, Long-Guan
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (19), 7935-7942CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The synthesis and crystal structures of [Pb(Hssal)(2,2'-bipy)(DMF)]n (1), [Pb(Hssal)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)]n (2), [Pb(Hssal)(phen)(DMF)]n (3), and [Pb3(ssal)2(phen)3]n (4) are reported, where Hssal2- and ssal3- are doubly and fully deprotonated 5-sulfosalicylates, 2,2'-bipy is 2,2'-bipyridine, and phen is 1,10-phenanthroline. Compds. 1-4 were synthesized by varying the reaction conditions, such as reaction temp., molar ratio, and pH, and these structures are formed by infinite chains or layers where PbII ions are linked by Hssal2- or ssal3- bridges. Compd. 1, which has a ladder like chain, was formed in DMF/H2O. Compd. 2 with a H2O mol. coordinated to PbII was prepd. by a hydrothermal reaction. Compds. 3 and 4 were prepd. at a higher pH compared to 1-2, contg. 2,2'-bipy. In 1-3, 5-sulfosalicylates are doubly deprotonated, whereas in 4, 5-sulfosalicylate is fully deprotonated. Coordination modes of Hssal2- and ssal3- ligands in 1-4 are novel and 1st reported here. Although compds. 1 and 3 have the same structural topol., their arom.-arom. interactions are significantly different. The coordination spheres of PbII ions in 1 and 3 are holodirected, whereas in 2 and 4, they feature somewhat hemidirected properties with small holes or gaps. Compd. 4 exhibits some interesting features; there is no solvent in the structure, there are extensive arom.-arom. stacking interactions among arom. rings, and there is a weak interaction between PbII atoms in the trinuclear motif.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XosVylsrg%253D&md5=4182b95e7531316cd2956c9557cbb527

      Three-Dimensional Eight- or Four-Connected Metal-Organic Frameworks Tuned by Hydrothermal Temperatures
      Liu, Cai-Ming; Gao, Song; Zhang, De-Qing; Zhu, Dao-Ben
      Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (7), 1312-1317CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Two novel three-dimensional (3D) metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) with Co(II) clusters as nodes and mixed bridging ligands as links, [Co4(OH)2(obbz)3(4,4'-bpy)2](4,4'-bpy) (obbz2- = N,N'-oxamidobis(benzoato), 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) (1) and [Co3(H2O)(obbz)3(4,4'-bpy)2](H2O)2 (2), were obtained from the same reaction mixt. but tuned by different hydrothermal temps. The 160° product 1 is a 3-dimensional MOF based on the novel tetranuclear cluster node [Co4(OH)2]6+, displaying a new eight-connected 364145464 topol. The 140° product 2 is a 2-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional MOF constructed from not only the binuclear cluster node [Co2(μ2-H2O)]4+ but also the mononuclear node Co2+, showing a distorted diamond network.

      Temp. dets. the product: The reaction of 1,3,5-triallyl-1,3,5-triazine-2,4,6-(1H,3H,5H)-trione with CuBr at 60° affords a copper(I)-olefin, coordination polymer with a Cu4Br4 open cubane as a connecting node; when the reaction is repeated at 90° a Cu6Br6 prismane unit is formed in a coordination polymer. The crystal structures of both coordination polymers were detd. and their cyclic voltammetry study is discussed.

      18b
      Novel supramolecular isomerism in coordination polymer synthesis from unsymmetrical bridging ligands: Solvent influence on the ligand placement orientation and final network structure
      Lee, In Su; Shin, Dong Mok; Chung, Young Keun
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2004), 10 (13), 3158-3165CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      The assembly of Co(NCS)2 with 1-methyl-1'-(3-pyridyl)-2-(4-pyridyl)ethene (L1) exhibits a novel supramol. isomerism of [Co(L1)2(NCS)2]∞ (1 and 2) caused by different placement orientation of L1 around metal centers. The reaction in MeOH/H2O and EtOH/H2O resulted in a double chain structure of 1, and that in EtOH/CH3NO2 led to an open framework structure of 2. The reaction in MeOH/CH3NO2 solvent system concomitantly afforded 1 and 2. The assemblies of 1-methyl-1'-(3-pyridyl)-2-(4-pyrimidyl)ethene (L2) with Co(NCS)2 created the H2O-coordinated complexes of Co(L2)2(H2O)2(NCS)2 (3 and 4), an MeOH coordinated complex of Co(L2)2(H2O)2(NCS)2 (5), and an open framework coordination polymer of [Co(L1)2(NCS)2]∞ (6) depending on the reaction solvent system. Probably in the formation of 1, the solvent-coordinated intermediate species would be generated 1st and its trans coordination configuration should define the placement orientation of L1 in the resulting polymer of 1. However, it is presumed that the solvent-coordinated intermediate would not be produced during the formation of 2 due to the weaker coordination ability of EtOH and CH3NO2 mols. The open framework coordination polymers of 2 and 6 are converted in the solid state into the isomeric coordination polymer of 1 and H bonded network structure of 3, resp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Toward self-organization and complex matter
      Lehn, Jean-Marie
      Science (Washington, DC, United States) (2002), 295 (5564), 2400-2403CODEN: SCIEAS; ISSN:0036-8075. (American Association for the Advancement of Science)
      A review with refs. Beyond mol. chem. based on the covalent bond, supramol. chem. aims at developing highly complex chem. systems from components interacting through noncovalent intermol. forces. Over the past quarter century, supramol. chem. has grown into a major field and has fueled numerous developments at the interfaces with biol. and physics. Some of the conceptual advances and future challenges are profiled here.

      Hydrothermal Syntheses, Crystal Structures, and Properties of a Novel Class of 3,3',4,4'-Benzophenone-tetracarboxylate (BPTC) Polymers
      Zhang, Jian; Li, Zhao-Ji; Kang, Yao; Cheng, Jian-Kai; Yao, Yuan-Gen
      Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (25), 8085-8091CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Three novel BPTC complexes, (H2BPTC)(4,4'-H2bpy)H2O (1), [Cd2Cu(HBPTC)2(μ2-4,4'-bpy)2(4,4'-bpy)2(H2O)2]n (2), and [Co3(HBPTC)2(μ2-4,4'-bpy)3(H2O)4]n·2nH2O (3) (BPTC = 3,3',4,4'-benzophenonetetracarboxylate and bpy = bipyridine), were hydrothermally synthesized. Complex 1, which was obtained as a coproduct during the syntheses of complexes 2 and 3, features a 2-dimensional layered strong hydrogen bonding network with 2-fold interpenetration. Complex 2 has an unusual 2-dimensional double-layered motif, which is linked together by Cu atoms in a face-to-face manner. It exhibits nanosized channels filled by 4,4'-bpy ligands. Three six-coordinated Co atoms in 3 are interlinked by HBPTC ligands to form a 2-dimensional grid structure, which is further sustained by rigid 4,4'-bpy ligands into a 3-dimensional open framework similar to CdSO4 with the BPTC moieties situated in the tunnels. The thermal stabilities of complexes 1-3 were examd. The photoluminescence properties of complexes 1-2 and temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility for 3 were also studied.

      Octameric water clusters of staircase structure present in a metal-organic framework built from helical lanthanide coordination polymers
      Ghosh, Sujit K.; Bharadwaj, Parimal K.
      European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2005), (24), 4886-4889CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Two lanthanide-carboxylate polymeric complexes contg. nine-coordinate lanthanide metal centers, {[Pr(ptc-3)·2H2O]·2H2O} (1), {[Nd(ptc-3)·2H2O]·2H2O} (2) were prepd. by hydrothermal synthesis of Pr(NO3)3·6H2O or Nd(NO3)3·6H2O with pyridine-2,4,6-tricarboxylic acid (ptcH3). These network structures were characterized by x-ray crystallog., powder x-ray diffraction, IR and thermal gravimetric analyses. Both 1 and 2 form infinite single helical chains with large widths and pitches contg. six metal ions per turn. The overall structure consists of two helixes connected via discrete octameric H2O clusters.

      Two structurally diverse compds., {[Co(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)4](hmbdc)(H2O)}n (1) and {[Co(4,4'-bipy)(hmbdc)(H2O)2](4,4'-bipy)(DMF)}n (2) (H2hmbdc = 5-hydroxyl-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid, 4,4'-bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine), were synthesized using different starting materials and solvents. Compd. 2 shows a 2-dimensional architecture and free 4,4'-bipy and DMF mols. fill in the channels of the extended 3-dimensional H bonding network as guest mols.

      21b
      Polycatenation, polythreading and polyknotting in coordination network chemistry
      Carlucci, Lucia; Ciani, Gianfranco; Proserpio, Davide M.
      Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2003), 246 (1-2), 247-289CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier Science B.V.)
      A review is presented on polycatenation, polythreading and polyknotting in coordination network chem. The use of crystal engineering concepts produced a variety of coordination networks, many of which exhibit novel and fascinating types of entanglements of individual motifs. This review analyses the structures of a no. of entangled polymeric networks reported in these years by many groups. A topol. classification of the different interlocked and interweaved species is attempted. Wide classes of polycatenated and polythreaded species were recognized and other phenomena, as polyknotting (self-penetration) and interweaving of 1-dimensional chains, are also discussed. Unexpected topol. features and new linkages, that were previously overviewed, were discovered, including the first examples of infinite Borromean links.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXpt1Gitr0%253D&md5=5727cc4be054c01d955b47f3cd366bc5

      21c
      Ni(tpt)(NO3)2 - a three-dimensional network with the exceptional (12,3) topology: a self-entangled single net
      Abrahams, Brendan F.; Batten, Stuart R.; Grannas, Martin J.; Hamit, Hasan; Hoskins, Bernard F.; Robson, Richard
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (1999), 38 (10), 1475-1477CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      Crystals of Ni(Tpt)(NO3)2, where tpt = tri-4-pyridyl-1,3,5-triazine, are trigonal, space group P3121, with a 15.216(2) and c 18.650(6) Å; Z = 3, dc = 1.554; R1 = 0.0839, Rw2 = 0.2352 for 5719 reflections. The crystal consists of a well-defined coordination polymer framework with (12,3) topol. contg. equal nos. of tpt and Ni2+ centers. Disordered solvent occupies the chiral channels running parallel with the helical axes. Each Ni center together with one of its coordinated pyridyl groups lies on a 2-fold axis, the other 2 pyridyl groups are cis to the first and related to each other by the 2-fold axis. The octahedral coordination of the Ni is center is completed by O atoms from monodentate and bidentate nitrate anions which are disordered around the 2-fold axis.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK1MXjsVyksbk%253D&md5=c9d721e1c8d6355a47e39ab4fe697a02
      (d) Jensen, P., Price, D. J., Batten, S. R., Moubaraki, B., and Murray, K. S. Chem.—Eur. J.2000 6 3186
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      21d
      Self-penetration - A structural compromise between single networks and interpenetration: magnetic properties and crystal structures of [Mn(dca)2-(H2O)] and [M(dca)(tcm)], M = Co, Ni, Cu, dca = dicyanamide, N(CN)2-, tcm = tricyanomethanide, C(CN)3-
      Jensen, Paul; Price, David J.; Batten, Stuart R.; Moubaraki, Boujemaa; Murray, Keith S.
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2000), 6 (17), 3186-3195CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      The three-dimensional coordination polymers [Mn(dca)2(H2O)] (1) and [M(dca)(tcm)], M = Co (2), Ni (3), Cu (4), dca = dicyanamide, N(CN)2-, tcm = tricyanomethanide, C(CN)3-, have isomorphous structures. In 1 half the dca ligands coordinate directly (through all three N atoms) to three Mn atoms (all metal atoms are six-coordinate), while the other half coordinate to two Mn atoms (through the nitrile N's) and H bond to H2O mols. coordinated to a third Mn atom (through the amide N). This dca·H2O structural moiety is disordered over a mirror plane, and is replaced by the structurally equiv. tcm ligand in compds. 2-4. The resulting structures display a new self-penetrating 3,6-connected (2:1) network topol. that can be related to, but is different from, the rutile net. The self-penetrating [M(dca)(tcm)] network can be viewed as a structural compromise between the two interpenetrating rutile-like networks of [M(tcm)2] and the single rutile-like network of α-[M(dca)2]. The temp. and field dependence of the d.c. and a.c. magnetic susceptibilities and magnetizations was measured for complexes 1-4. Compds. 1-3 exhibit long-range magnetic order with crit. temps. of 6.3 K for 1, 3.5 K for 2, and 8.0 K for 3. The CuII compd. 4 does not order and is essentially a paramagnet. Hysteresis measurements of coercive field and remnant magnetization show that 1, 2 and 3 are soft magnets, 1 being a canted-spin antiferromagnet (weak ferromagnet), while 2 and 3 are ferromagnets that display some unusual features in their high-field magnetization isotherms in comparison to their related α-[M(dca)2] phases.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3cXms1Cjsbc%253D&md5=2904320f52d415754a82e85283cee724
      (e) Wang, X.-L., Qin, C., Wang, E.-B., Su, Z.-M., Xu, L., and Batten, S. R. Chem. Commun.2005 4789
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar

      An unprecedented eight-connected self-penetrating network based on pentanuclear zinc cluster building blocks
      Wang, Xin-Long; Qin, Chao; Wang, En-Bo; Su, Zhong-Min; Xu, Lin; Batten, Stuart R.
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2005), (38), 4789-4791CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The 1st eight-connected self-penetrating metal-org. framework, based on pentanuclear Zn cluster building blocks, defines a new self-penetrating topol. for eight-connected networks and represents the highest connected topol. presently known for self-penetrating systems. [Zn5(μ3-OH)2(bdc)4(phen)2] (I) was prepd. from Zn(NO3)2, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2bdc) and phen in presence of H2O. I is triclinic, space group P‾1, Z = 1, R1 = 0.0397, wR2 = 0.0889.

      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXhtVeqs7zF&md5=513ef7e0a762951730bea63798f9b790
      (f) Tong, M.-L., Chen, X.-M., and Batten, S. R. J. Am. Chem. Soc.2003 125 16170
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      21f
      A New Self-Penetrating Uniform Net, (8,4) (or 86), Containing Planar Four-Coordinate Nodes
      Tong, Ming-Liang; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Batten, Stuart R.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2003), 125 (52), 16170-16171CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reaction of 3-(3-pyridyl)acrylic acid (pyaraH) with NiCl2 and NaOH gave different polymorphs at different temps. α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 forms at 180°, and has a 3-dimensional polymeric structure. The topol. of the network is that of a self-penetrating, four-coordinate (8,4) network (Schlafli symbol 86). This is the first uniform net to contain only planar four-coordinate nodes, and it is also the first four-coordinate uniform net not to have the Schlafli symbol 66. This fundamental network topol. was previously unrecognized. The second polymorph, the β phase, forms from an analogous reaction at 150°, and contains 1-dimensional chains hydrogen bonded into a 3-dimensional network. Preliminary crystal data for iron(II) and cobalt(II) complexes which are isostructural with α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 are presented.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXps1Snurs%253D&md5=f20f6603e49e46af14b5800dea774afb

      (a) Sun, H.-L., Gao, S., Ma, B.-Q., and Batten, S. R. CrystEngComm2004 6 579

      22a
      3D self-penetrating coordination network constructed by dicyanamide and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane-N,N'-dioxide (bpeado)
      Sun, Hao-Ling; Gao, Song; Ma, Bao-Qing; Batten, Stuart R.
      CrystEngComm (2004), 6 (), 579-583CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The complexes M(dca)2(bpeado) (M = Mn (1), Fe (2), Co (3), Ni (4), Cu (5); dca = dicyanamide; bpeado = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane-N,N'-dioxide) were synthesized and characterized by x-ray single crystal diffraction. Compds. 1-5 contain 3-dimensional self-penetrating networks, in which bidentate dca ligands bridge the octahedral metal ions to form square-grid like M(dca)2 sheets and these sheets are further connected by criss-crossing bpeado to give a 3-dimensional self-penetrating network. Variable temp. magnetic susceptibility studies showed that these compds. generally display very weak antiferromagnetic coupling because of the long bpeado and μ1,5-dca pathways. Consequently, no magnetic ordering was found.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXhtVKitLfJ&md5=b86b38e956d259b689b7794504da48c5
      (b) Abrahams, B. F., Hardie, M. J., Hoskins, B. F., Robson, R., and Sutherland, E. E. J. Chem. Soc., Chem. Commun.1994 1049
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      22b
      Infinite square-grid [Cd(CN)2]n sheets linked together by either pyrazine bridges or polymerizable 1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)butadiyne bridges arranged in an unusual criss-cross fashion
      Abrahams, Brendan F.; Hardie, Michaele J.; Hoskins, Bernard F.; Robson, Richard; Sutherland, Elizabeth E.
      Journal of the Chemical Society, Chemical Communications (1994), (9), 1049-50CODEN: JCCCAT; ISSN:0022-4936.
      Cd(CN)2.pyz (pyz= pyrazine) and Cd(CN)2.bpb (bpb = 1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)butadiyne) contain square-grid [Cd(CN)2]n sheets linked together by either pyrazine bridges or bpb bridges which criss-cross in an unusual fashion producing face-to-face stacks of pyrazine rings and collections of bpb units in which every one is sandwiched between 6 others, 3 on each side; butadiyne C4 moieties are brought thereby into close proximity (closest C...C contact 3.36 Å) and the initially colorless Cd(CN)2.pbp crystals acquire a deep blue-purple color on exposure to light indicating diacetylene polymn. within the crystal. Cd(CN)2.pyz is orthorhombic, space group Ccc2, with a 7.428(1), b 13.278(2), and c 8.005(3) Å; Z = 4, dc = 2.04, dm = 2.00(2); R = 0.025, Rw = 0.024 for 347 reflections. Cd(CN)2.bpb is monoclinic, space group C2/c, with a 24.555(8), b 7.239(2). c 8.348(3) Å, and β 106.16(4)°; Z = 4, dc = 1.72, dm = 1.72(1); R = 0.1066 for 821 reflections.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK2cXlvFWru70%253D&md5=1f02e9d023feda157317b05c071cd41f

      (a) Zhao, X. J., Batten, S. R., and Du, M. Acta Crystallogr., Sect. E2004 60m1237

      23a
      [CuI4CuII(CN)6(DMF)4]n (DMF is N,N'-dimethylformamide): redetermination and topological analysis of a mixed-valence copper-cyanide coordination polymer with a unique six-connected self-penetrating network
      Zhao, Xiao Jun; Batten, Stuart R.; Du, Miao
      Acta Crystallographica, Section E: Structure Reports Online (2004), E60 (9), m1237-m1239CODEN: ACSEBH; ISSN:1600-5368. (International Union of Crystallography)
      The title coordination polymer, poly[[tetrakis(N,N'-DMF)pentacopper(I,II)]-tetra-μ2-cyano-di-μ3-cyano], whose structure (S. M. Peng and D. S. Liaw, 1986) was redetd. using CCD data, contains four crystallog. independent Cu centers, including three CuI ions with tetrahedral or linear geometries and one CuII ion in an octahedral environment. These Cu centers are connected by bidentate and tridentate cyanide bridges to form a unique self-penetrating network with 446108 topol., which was analyzed. Three of the Cu atoms have site symmetries of ‾1, 2 and 2. Crystals of the coordination polymer are monoclinic, space group C2/c, with a 14.054(4), b 12.597(4), c 16.424(5) Å, β 92.008(6)Å; Z = 4, dc = 1.752; R = 0.048, Rw(F2) = 0.092 for 2971 reflections.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXntFamu70%253D&md5=38ebe3f0496c401843f5a8d302ba44a3
      (b) Long, D.-L., Hill, R. J., Blake, A. J., Champness, N. R., Hubberstey, P., Wilson, C., and Schröder, M. Chem.—Eur. J.2005 11 1384
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      23b
      Anion control over interpenetration and framework topology in coordination networks based on homoleptic six-connected scandium nodes
      Long, De-Liang; Hill, Robert J.; Blake, Alexander J.; Champness, Neil R.; Hubberstey, Peter; Wilson, Claire; Schroeder, Martin
      Chemistry - A European Journal (2005), 11 (5), 1384-1391CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Reaction of ScX3 (X = NO3-, CF3SO3-, ClO4-) with 4,4'-bipyridine-N,N'-dioxide (L) affords topol. distinct six-connected three-dimensional coordination frameworks, {[Sc(L)3](NO3)3}∞ (1), {[Sc(L)3](CF3SO3)3(MeOH)2.7(H2O)3}∞ (2), {[Sc(L)3](ClO4)3}∞ (3) and {[Sc(L)4(H2O)2](ClO4)3}∞ (4). Compds. 1, 2 and 3 are networks based on octahedrally coordinated ScO6 centers bound through six O atoms from six sep. N-oxide ligands L. Compds. 1 and 3 are doubly interpenetrated and have α-Po-type structures of 41263 topol. based upon three intersecting (4,4) nets. The structure of 2 is unusual and shows parallel, coplanar layers of (4,4) nets connected in a crisscrossed fashion to afford a new 48668 topol. In 4 only four ligands L bind to each ScIII center with two addnl. H2O mols. bridging metal nodes. Significantly, the bridges formed by L do not sit in a plane and if connections through L are considered alone the resultant structure is a diamondoid array typically based upon a tetrahedral connecting node at Sc. Five interpenetrating diamondoid networks are obsd. that are cross-bridged by H2O mols. to form a single three-dimensional array of 4867 topol. Compd. 4 can also be viewed as incorporating two intersecting (4,4) grids based upon two ligands L and two bridging waters. Thus, variation of anion, solvent and conditions critically affects the structures of products formed, and polymers reported herein illustrates how tectons based upon (4,4) grids can be combined and distorted to form non-NaCl topologies and even cross-bridged, multiply interpenetrated diamondoid materials. Both compds. 2 and 4 represent unusual examples of self-penetrated coordination frameworks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXitVOmt74%253D&md5=3f48d7900dc44072c12533ef1a8489e3
    24. 24
      Luo, J. H., Hong, M. C., Wang, R. H., Cao, R., Han, L., Yuan, D. Q., Lin, Z. Z., and Zhou, Y. F. Inorg. Chem.2003 42 4486
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      24
      A Novel Bilayer Cobalt(II)-Organic Framework with Nanoscale Channels Accommodating Large Organic Molecules
      Luo, Junhua; Hong, Maochun; Wang, Ruihu; Cao, Rong; Han, Lei; Yuan, Daqiang; Lin, Zhenzhong; Zhou, Youfu
      Inorganic Chemistry (2003), 42 (15), 4486-4488CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A unique noninterpenetrated 2-dimensional bilayer Co(II)-org. framework, [{Co(dpe)(NO2-BDC)}·0.5(dpe)]n·nH2O (1), possessing nanoscale rectangular channels that clathrate large org. mols., was hydrothermally synthesized by reaction of Co(NO3)2 with 5-nitro-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid (NO2-H2BDC) and (E)-1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethylene (dpe).
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXks12msrg%253D&md5=2c926918423141c13e732f90d436c98d

      (a) Xu, Y. Q., Yuan, D. Q., Wu, B. L., Han, L., Wu, M. Y., Jiang, F. L., and Hong, M. C. Cryst. Growth Des.2006 6 1168

      25a
      1D Tube, 2D Layer, and 3D Framework Derived from A New Series of Metal(II)-5-Aminodiacetic Isophthalate Coordination Polymers
      Xu, Yanqing; Yuan, Daqiang; Wu, Benlai; Han, Lei; Wu, Mingyan; Jiang, Feilong; Hong, Maochun
      Crystal Growth & Design (2006), 6 (5), 1168-1174CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Three novel coordination polymers, [Cu2(adip)(H2O)4]n·nH2O (1), [Co3(Hadip)2(H2O)6]n·2nH2O (2), and [Zn7(adip)4(H2O)10K2(H2O)2]n·4nH2O (3), were solvothermally synthesized by adopting a new type of multicarboxylate ligand, H4adip (H4adip = 5-(bis(carboxymethyl)amino)isophthalic acid). Compd. 1 features a 1-dimensional tube-like structure, compd. 2 shows novel 2-dimensional (3,4)-connected nets, and compd. 3 possesses an interesting 3-dimensional architecture, all of which possess channels hosting guest H2O mols. A particular interest of the adip4- ligand is its propensity to bind metal ions forming various metallocycles, which could be viewed as the basic building blocks in the construction of supramol. frameworks. Thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) were performed on compds. 1, 2, and 3. Variable-temp. magnetic susceptibility of 2 was studied. An intense blue luminescence with an emission band peaking at 454 nm obsd. for 3 may result from ligand-to-metal charge transfer (LMCT).
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xjt1Kmtbs%253D&md5=d0a0a0995925e6d67f1d36bb5f99a492
      (b) Bourne, S. A., Lu, J. J., Mondal, A., Moulton, B., and Zaworotko, M. J. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed.2001 40 2111
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      25b
      Self-assembly of nanometer-scale secondary building units into an undulating two-dimensional network with two types of hydrophobic cavity
      Bourne, Susan A.; Lu, Jianjiang; Mondal, Arunendu; Moulton, Brian; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2001), 40 (11), 2111-2113CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      The compds. {[M2(1,3-bdc)2(py)2]4}n (1,3-bdc = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, py = pyridine, M = Zn and Cu) were prepd. and characterized by x-ray crystallog. The complexes consist of the nanometer-scale secondary building units [M2(1,3-bdc)2(py)2], four of which combine to form the bowl-shaped secondary building unit {[M2(1,3-bdc)2(py)2]4}, which in turn self-assembles with other units to form an undulating two-dimensional sheet network structure in {[M2(1,3-bdc)2(py)2]4}n. Both complexes contain benzene and pyridine guest mols. occupying the bowls and hour-glass shaped channels between adjacent bowls. The shape and chem. nature of the bowls resemble calixarenes.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXksVOisbg%253D&md5=84c90760071c0a92b97835851a772737

      25c
      A Novel Helical Double-Layered Cobalt(II)-Organic Framework with Tetranuclear [Co4(μ3-OH)2] Clusters Linked by an Unsymmetrical Pyridyl-benzoate Ligand
      Luo, Junhua; Zhao, Yusheng; Xu, Hongwu; Kinnibrugh, Tiffany L.; Yang, Dali; Timofeeva, Tatiana V.; Daemen, Luke L.; Zhang, Jianzhong; Bao, Wei; Thompson, Joe D.; Currier, Robert P.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2007), 46 (22), 9021-9023CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A novel cobalt(II)-org. framework [Co2(OH)(3,4-PBC)3]n has been acquired by the reaction of CoO with an unsym. pyridyl-benzoate ligand, 3-pyrid-4-ylbenzoic acid (3,4-PBC). Single-crystal X-ray diffraction studies reveal that it is comprized of [CoII4(μ3-OH)2] clusters linked by the unsym. ligand 3,4-PBC forming a novel helical double-layered metal-org. architecture. A significant overall antiferromagnetic behavior has been obsd. for this compd.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtVKmsbvO&md5=1cabf71d4dcf514910d70cabc558e0f8

      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      25d
      Dinuclear cobalt(II) complexes of an acyclic phenol-based dinucleating ligand with four methoxyethyl chelating arms - First magnetic analyses in an axially distorted octahedral field
      Sakiyama, Hiroshi; Ito, Rie; Kumagai, Hitoshi; Inoue, Katsuya; Sakamoto, Masatomi; Nishida, Yuzo; Yamasaki, Mikio
      European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2001), (8), 2027-2032CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      An end-off type acyclic ligand with four methoxyethyl chelating arms, 2,6-bis[bis(2-methoxyethyl)aminomethyl]-4-methylphenol [H(bomp)], formed dinuclear cobalt(II) complexes [Co2(bomp)(MeCO2)2]BPh4 (1) and [Co2(bomp)(PhCO2)2]BPh4 (2). X-ray anal. revealed that complex 1·CHCl3 contains two cobalt ions bridged by a phenolic oxygen and two acetate groups, forming a μ-phenoxo-bis(μ-acetato)dicobalt(II) core. Magnetic susceptibility was measured for 1 and 2 over the temp. range 1.8-300 K. The data were successfully analyzed using a new theor. method assuming an axially distorted octahedral field (Δ = 753 and 775 cm-1, resp.) for each cobalt(II) ion to reveal weak antiferromagnetic interactions (J = -0.96 and -1.74 cm-1, resp.).
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXls1SgurY%253D&md5=f8d054b138567a86d01ecb11b64054ea
      (e) Wang, Y. L., Yuan, D. Q., Bi, W. H., Li, X., Li, X. J., Li, F., and Cao, R. Cryst. Growth. Des.2005 5 1849
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      25e
      Syntheses and Characterizations of Two 3D Cobalt-Organic Frameworks from 2D Honeycomb Building Blocks
      Wang, Yu-Ling; Yuan, Da-Qiang; Bi, Wen-Hua; Li, Xing; Li, Xiao-Ju; Li, Feng; Cao, Rong
      Crystal Growth & Design (2005), 5 (5), 1849-1855CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      The hydrothermal reaction of Co(NO3)2·6H2O, imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3IDC), and 4,4'-bipyridine (bipy) under different conditions affords two interesting metal-org. compds., {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (1) and {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)3]·6H2O·DMF}n (2), both of which have been structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction, elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and thermogravimetric anal. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility for 1 and 2 were also studied. The "all-chair" two-dimensional honeycomb networks, structurally analogous to CFx, were linked by the bridging 4,4'-bipy ligand in compd. 1 to give rise to a 2-fold interpenetrated 3D architecture. Compd. 2 features a three-dimensional open framework with hexagonal channels, generated from two-dimensional graphene-like layers pillared by 4,4'-bipy. The simplest cyclic motif of the 2D networks in 1 and 2 is a 24-membered hexagonal ring consisting of six Co(II) cations and six IDC3- trianions.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXltlyrsr4%253D&md5=417c6505e947d4e9aae5824fe66bd5b4
      (f) Blake, A. B. J. Chem. Soc., Chem. Commun.1966 569

      1. 1
        (a) Sun, D., Ma, S., Ke, Y., Collins, D. J., and Zhou, H. C. J. Am. Chem. Soc.2006 128 3896
